anime.description: Junjo Romantica 3 follows the ongoing story of three couples: The Romantica relationship between college student Misaki Takahashi and his tutor, Akihiko Usami. The stormy Egoist couple—Professor Hiroki Kamijou, a tsundere, doted on by Nowaki Kusama. The dramatic Terrorist couple—divorced literature professor Yo Miyagi, and his younger lover, Shinobu Tatasuki. It`s complicated. But so worth it. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: josei
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word josei refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 15 and 44. In Japanese, the word means simply "woman", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic.

tag.name: shounen ai
tag.description: Shounen Ai means boys love, and thus explores what happens when two boys (or men) fall in love. This is not to be mistaken for http://anidb.net/t2723 [Yaoi] which is (or, at least, how this term is often used by the western audience) used in adult works. This is not; that means there is no graphical sex. The female version is http://anidb.net/t2782 [Shoujo Ai].

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

character.name: Takatsuki Shinobu
character.description: A law student at a national university in Tokyo. He`s dating his sister`s ex-husband, who is 17 years older than him.

character.name: Isaka Ryuuichirou
character.description: Isaka Ryuuichirou is the senior managing director of Marukawa Publishing. He is acquainted with Sekaiichi Hatsukoi`s Ritsu`s parents and is a childhood friend of Junjou Romantica`s Haruhiko. He is 32 years old in the main time line. Isaka aspired to be a novelist, but his real talents lay in finding future best-sellers. He appears in both Sekaiichi Hatsukoi and Junjou Romantica and is together with his assistant Asahina the main character of the short comics released with the Junjou Romantica DVDs, Junjou Mistake. Junjou Mistake takes place ten years before the main Romantica storyline.

character.name: Ijuuin Kyou
character.description: A mangaka working for Marukawa. He went through a very hard time, until one day meeting Misaki.

character.name: Takahashi Mahiro
character.description: Takahashi Takahiro`s son, and thus Misaki`s nephew.

character.name: Shiina Mizuki
character.description: Mizuki is Akihiko`s cousin. He resides in America. He instantly dislikes Misaki, as he thinks he`s a better match with his cousin.

character.name: Kendou Bu In
character.description: The member of the Kendo Club calling out for Toudou Shinnosuke. Can only be seen from the back.

character.name: Kimura
character.description: Kimura takes care of Misaki at his part-time job.

character.name: Harada
character.description: Harada is the interviewer of Akihiko and Kyou.

episode.title: 石に立つ矢
Where There`s a Will, There`s a Way
Ishi ni Tatsu Ya
episode.summary: When Shinobu realizes that he always cooks Miyagi the same thing and they`ve never been on a "real date," he starts feeling insecure. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 盲亀の浮木
Finding Hen`s Teeth
Mouki no Fuboku
episode.summary: Misaki and Todo get autographs from their idol. Kaoruko and Mizuki get their feelings out in the open. Usagi mainly just gets a foreboding of doom. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 遠慮なければ近憂あり
Failing to Plan Is Planning to Fail
Enryonakereba Kinyuu Ari
episode.summary: Misaki is having trouble deciding on a career, and Usagi is feeling maybe just a teeny-tiny bit insecure about the future. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花に嵐
All Good Things Must Come to an End
Hana ni Arashi
episode.summary: Misaki Takahashi has been living with his secret boyfriend, the rich and famous boys-love author Akihiko Usami, for three years now. He thinks nothing`s changed between them or inside his own heart in that time, but is he just fooling himself? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 焼き餅焼くとも手を焼くな
A Jealousy Too Hot May Burn a Man
Yakimochi Yaku to mo Te o Yakuna
episode.summary: Misaki has a conversation in which he drastically misunderstands both his own words and what the other party says in response. Usagi, on the other hand, understands all too well when he finds out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 灯台下暗し
The Darkest Place Is Under the Candlestick
Toudaimotokurashi
episode.summary: Ryuichiro Isaka, president of Marukawa Books, has been together with Kaoru Asahina forever. But that doesn`t make him a mind-reader and Asahina`s unique communication style or lack thereof tends to have him fearing the worst. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青天の霹靂
A Bolt from the Blue
Seiten no Hekireki
episode.summary: Misaki`s phone is ringing off the hook as people congratulate him on getting hired. Usagi is dealing with this in a calm and rational manner. Obviously. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 千里の道も一歩から
Even the Longest Journey Begins with a Single Step
Senri no Michi mo Ippo kara
episode.summary: With his applications taken care of, Misaki now has to face the dreaded interview process. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋路は縁のもの
True Love Is Fate
Koiji wa En no Mono
episode.summary: Convincing Usagi to attend his own awards ceremony is an uphill battle, since he`s far more interested in celebrating Misaki`s birthday. Unfortunately, so is Kyo Ijuin... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋には身をやつせ
Labor for Love
Koi ni wa Mi o Yatsuse
episode.summary: Usagi has been acting strangely ever since the interview with Mr. Ijuin, but Misaki can`t get him to say what`s really on his mind. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逢いたいが情, 見たいが病
Hours Are Like Days to Lovers Parted
Aitai ga Jou, Mitai ga Yamai
episode.summary: When Nowaki is so busy at work that he can`t come home for his own birthday, he and Kamijou start questioning their expectations of each other. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 水火の争い
A Battle of Irreconcilable Enemies
Suika no Arasoi
episode.summary: Usagi and Mr. Ijuin have a private conversation, which goes smashingly. Later, Misaki is forced to face an unpleasant truth about himself. Source: crunchyroll
